Funtion.Detail: Protein which interferes with transcription, usually by binding to specific sites on DNA. Also used for proteins which repress translation.
Any molecular function by which a gene product interacts selectively with DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid).

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.
Funtion.Keyword: Sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor activity

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with 2-amino-5-(carbamimidamido)pentanoic acid.

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
The cellular synthesis of RNA on a template of DNA.
The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of amino acids, organic acids containing one or more amino substituents.
The cellular synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
The chemical reactions and pathways resulting in the formation of arginine, 2-amino-5-(carbamimidamido)pentanoic acid.

The process of creating protein oligomers, compounds composed of a small number, usually between three and ten, of component monomers; protein oligomers may be composed of different or identical monomers. Oligomers may be formed by the polymerization of a number of monomers or the depolymerization of a large protein polymer.
